page.title: 02TOWN TWINNING
page.content: During 1982 the Council agreed to explore the possibility of entering into a Town Twinning arrangement with a European town. In 1983 the Council decided to formalise a twinning agreement with Cergy_Pontoise in France. Cergy_Pontoise lies 20 miles north west of Paris and is similar to Ormskirk and West Lancashire in that the population is about 110,000 and contains a new town similar to Skelmersdale with a population of 40,000. as well as a number of small villages in it's vicinity. Pontoise is a market town like Ormskirk and although it is so close to Paris it is in open countryside and a rich agricultural area similar to the West Lancashire Plain which surrounds Ormskirk.
